basic_operations

Class ReducedMatrixOperations

  • java.lang.Object
    • basic_operations.ReducedMatrixOperations

  • public class ReducedMatrixOperations
extends java.lang.Object
    A collection of static methods for performing elementary square matrix operations modulo a short prime.
    Author:
    pdokos

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static short[][] constructElementaryMtx(int dimension, int h, int k)
      Constructs the matrix which has ones along the diagonal and at the (h, k) entry, with zeros everywhere else.
      static short[][] constructIdentityMtx(int dimension)
      Constructs the identity matrix of the given dimension.
      static short[][] constructRandomElement(int rowLength, int columnLength, short n)
      Constructs a matrix with random integer entries mod n.
      static short[][] constructRandomInvertibleElement(int dimension, short q)
      Constructs a square matrix with random entries modulo a prime q, which is also non-singular mod q.
      static int determinantModQ(int[][] entries, int q)
      Computes the determinant of a square matrix modulo a prime q via Gaussian elimination.
      static short determinantModQ(short[][] entries, short q)
      Computes the determinant of a square matrix modulo a prime q via Gaussian elimination.
      static short[][] inverseModQ(short[][] entries, short q)
      Computes the inverse of a square matrix modulo a prime q via Gaussian elimination.
      static short[][] negative(short[][] a, short n)
      Computes the reduced negative of a short integer matrix modulo n.
      static short[][] reduce(int[][] entries, short n)
      Computes the reduction of an integer matrix modulo a short integer n.
      static short[][] reduce(short[][] entries, short n)
      Computes the reduction of a short integer matrix modulo a short integer n.
      static short[][] reducedProduct(short[][] a, short[][] b, short n)
      Computes the reduced product of two short integer matrices a and b modulo n.
      static short[][] reducedSum(short[][] a, short[][] b, short n)
      Computes the reduced sum of two short integer matrices a and b modulo n.
      static short[][] scalarMultiply(short a, short[][] b, short n)
      Computes the product of the matrix b by the scalar a modulo n.
      static short[][] transpose(short[][] a)
      Creates the transpose matrix.

    • Method Detail

      • reduce

        public static short[][] reduce(int[][] entries,
               short n)
        Computes the reduction of an integer matrix modulo a short integer n.
        Parameters:
        entries - an integer matrix
        n - any nonzero short integer
        Returns:
        the reduction of entries modulo n.

      • reduce

        public static short[][] reduce(short[][] entries,
               short n)
        Computes the reduction of a short integer matrix modulo a short integer n.
        Parameters:
        entries - a short integer matrix
        n - any nonzero short integer
        Returns:
        the reduction of entries modulo n.

      • determinantModQ

        public static short determinantModQ(short[][] entries,
                    short q)
        Computes the determinant of a square matrix modulo a prime q via Gaussian elimination. The return value is 0 if the entries is not a square matrix, or if q is not prime.
        Parameters:
        entries - a square matrix of shorts
        q - any short prime number
        Returns:
        the inverse of the matrix mod q. Returns null if the inverse does not exist, or q is not prime.

      • determinantModQ

        public static int determinantModQ(int[][] entries,
                  int q)
        Computes the determinant of a square matrix modulo a prime q via Gaussian elimination. The return value is 0 if the entries is not a square matrix, or if q is not prime.
        Parameters:
        entries - a square matrix
        q - any prime number
        Returns:
        the inverse of the matrix mod q. Returns null if the inverse does not exist, or q is not prime.

      • inverseModQ

        public static short[][] inverseModQ(short[][] entries,
                    short q)
        Computes the inverse of a square matrix modulo a prime q via Gaussian elimination. The return value is null if the inverse does not exist, or if q is not prime.
        Parameters:
        entries - a square matrix of shorts
        q - any short prime number
        Returns:
        the inverse of the matrix mod q. Returns null if the inverse does not exist, or q is not prime.

      • negative

        public static short[][] negative(short[][] a,
                 short n)
        Computes the reduced negative of a short integer matrix modulo n.
        Parameters:
        a - any short integer matrix
        n - any non-zero short integer
        Returns:
        The reduced negative of the matrix a modulo n. Returns null if either the row or column dimension is 0.

      • reducedSum

        public static short[][] reducedSum(short[][] a,
                   short[][] b,
                   short n)
        Computes the reduced sum of two short integer matrices a and b modulo n.
        Parameters:
        a - any short integer matrix
        b - any short integer matrix
        n - any non-zero short integer
        Returns:
        the reduced sum of a and b mod n. Returns null if there is a dimension mismatch, or if any dimensions are 0

      • reducedProduct

        public static short[][] reducedProduct(short[][] a,
                       short[][] b,
                       short n)
        Computes the reduced product of two short integer matrices a and b modulo n.
        Parameters:
        a - any short integer matrix
        b - any short integer matrix
        n - any non-zero short integer
        Returns:
        the reduced product of a and b mod n. Returns null if there is a dimension mismatch, or if any dimensions are 0

      • transpose

        public static short[][] transpose(short[][] a)
        Creates the transpose matrix.
        Parameters:
        a - any short integer matrix
        Returns:
        the transpose of a

      • scalarMultiply

        public static short[][] scalarMultiply(short a,
                       short[][] b,
                       short n)
        Computes the product of the matrix b by the scalar a modulo n.
        Parameters:
        a - any short integer
        b - any short integer matrix
        n - any non-zero short integer
        Returns:
        the product of the matrix b by the scalar a modulo n.

        public static short[][] constructIdentityMtx(int dimension)
        Constructs the identity matrix of the given dimension.
        Parameters:
        dimension - the dimension of the desired identity matrix
        Returns:
        the identity matrix of dimension n.

      • constructElementaryMtx

        public static short[][] constructElementaryMtx(int dimension,
                               int h,
                               int k)
        Constructs the matrix which has ones along the diagonal and at the (h, k) entry, with zeros everywhere else.
        Parameters:
        dimension - any positive integer
        h - the row index of the non-zero element, in the range 1,...,dimension
        k - the column index of the non-zero element, in the range 1,...,dimension
        Returns:
        the matrix which has ones along the diagonal and at the (h, k) entry, with zeros everywhere else.

      • constructRandomElement

        public static short[][] constructRandomElement(int rowLength,
                               int columnLength,
                               short n)
        Constructs a matrix with random integer entries mod n.
        Parameters:
        rowLength - any positive integer
        columnLength - any positive integer
        n - any non-zero short integer
        Returns:
        a matrix with random integer entries in the range 0, 1, ... |n|-1

      • constructRandomInvertibleElement

        public static short[][] constructRandomInvertibleElement(int dimension,
                                         short q)
        Constructs a square matrix with random entries modulo a prime q, which is also non-singular mod q.
        Parameters:
        dimension - any positive integer
        q - any short integer prime
        Returns:
        a square matrix with random entries in the range 0, 1, ... |q|-1, which is invertible mod q
